p: Piper obliquum leaves are utilized in the Central and South America, especially Guyana and Ecuador, as analgesic or antiarthritic by topic application on the affected body part [ 36, 115]. Specifically, the Ketchwa Indians in Ecuador used P. obliquum to treat dental problems while the warmed leaves of P. obliquum is used by the Patamona Amerindians in Guyana for treating pains, muscular aches and for arthritis. In addition, the stem of the plant is used in the French Guiana folk medicine to treat hernia.
